TopicTitle: Newt - Compact VTOL Dropship (With Special Limited Edition Tylo Lander!)

Articles.Content:
CRAFT FILE:
http://goo.gl/LjBCxu

Designed originally as a Tylo lander the bare bones T model Newt puts out a massive 6K of Delta V. Enough to land on Tylo from a 15k orbit and return with a good safely margin.



It does this without dropping any tanks which is always a plus, as there's nothing more dangerous then an enraged environmentalist.



The standard model seen here adds such niceties as leather trim, alloy wheels, a cockpit, glove box, RCS system, CD changer and 3 year roadside assistance.



Despite the extra weight the standard version still puts out an impressive 5K of Delta V with good T/W on most planets/moons.



It tips the scales 12t on the pad making it a doddle to get into orbit. A complimentary Launch Vehicle has more then enough DV to get you all the way to the Jool system if needbe!



A special cargo port at the base of the hull allows small payloads to be transported with ease.



Free buggy with every purchase! (while stocks last, limit of one per customer)




CONTROLS:
1 - Toggle Main Engines
3 - Toggle Nav Lights
5 - Toggle Torque (Buggy Only)
9 - Toggle Ladder
0 - Detach Droptanks -Undock Fwd/Aft Ports

ABORT - Undock - De-Couple Cargo Port (Action Group Must Also Be Setup On Cargo's Docking Port)


OWNERS GUIDE:
Like my previous designs the Newt features a horizontal cockpit for suborbital flying/landing and a vertically mounted docking port for orbital piloting. When performing burns with the navball the top docking port must be selected, this also applies if using Mechjeb. If you're not used to VTOLs and would rather fly the Tadpole like a regular rocket the top docking port can be used for whole missions if need be. SAS should be left on at all times. When landing back on Kerbin you'll need to dump most of your fuel during re-entry with only the center tank at full level or less.

Finally I just want to give a shout out to Andrew Hansen whose Tylo SSTO video was the inspiration for the Newt. Cheers Andrew!

Cupcake...
